channel.title: Basic content partially done
channel.description:
So I am looking for a server (preferably pi just cause it won't be hosted) that has some "basic" content but not overfilled either. I have been getting this really sick idea for a piece of content and while I am learning a little java I wanted to try to start to develop it.
I don't need anything fancy with like 748 cache etc just something basic that can be used and that has packets etc already done ( cause frankly I doubt I am anywhere near that point )

item.title: Basic content partially done
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

I never said that I was learning via programming rsps, I just said I wanted to try out a random idea in general lol… I have seen the files/am relatively knowledgeable on the documentation in PI that’s why I stated PI specifically. This isn’t going to be a hosted item and etc…

Read full topic

item.title: Basic content partially done
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

xxxtilllyxxx:

Lil_Smok3r, I remember you started like that. Are you any less braindead now than when you started? The BEST way for you to possibly learn, is to read the JAVA DOCS. And buy a book on Java. Once you know the basics, you’re ready to start with something more advanced. I.e, an RSPS.

Please go and commit suicide.
[size=1pt]Joking. Calm down. Don’t rage. Don’t eat me[/size]

Read full topic

item.title: Basic content partially done
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“dwarfs222, post:2, topic:517666”]So you’re learning Java? .
The best way to start is Hyperion or Delta.[/quote]

No.

[quote=“scapedef, post:3, topic:517666”][quote author=dwarfs222 link=topic=635929.msg4287748#msg4287748 date=1366662553]
So you’re learning Java?
I suggest to NOT start with 1 742 RSPS.
The best way to start is Hyperion or Delta.
When you’re getting better, you can change your revision 317 --> 474 --> 508
–> 634 --> 718 --> 742
I know I skipped some…
[/quote]
BAD IDEA
The best Option is to Start with Pi[/quote]

Even worse.

Start out with Hyperion and using the wiki, they’ll both teach you some vital things about the RS2 protocol and programming properly.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic content partially done
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

If you learning java dont start with rsps but its dosent really matter what rsps version you coding, good luck

Read full topic

item.title: Basic content partially done
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

Never said Hyperion wasn’t a perfect base. There is no such thing as a “perfect base”. Who defines what is perfect. Nobody, because programming always has a better way of doing something. PI is a very perfect base unless you talk about the over-abundant synchronization, the memory leaks, the thousands of instanced arrays which are never used, the dead code, the thousands of errors, the shitty implementations, the shitty task system, the shitty event system, the shitty game tick, shall I name another thousand problems?

Read full topic

item.title: Basic content partially done
item.dc:creator: @Cyberus Cyberus
item.description:
@Cyberus wrote:

[quote=“scapedef, post:7, topic:517666”][quote author=xxxtilllyxxx link=topic=635929.msg4287836#msg4287836 date=1366671849]
scapedef shut the love up you arrogant inbred. Don’t tell another member to “quit” when his advice is literally 1000x better than yours. Project Insanity is a HORRIBLE base to start with. It will teach you how to host a shitty leached server and call yourself a “coder”. Atleast start with Hyperion. Because it will teach you to use proper documentation, conventions, and is a good base to begin with.
[/quote]
Dont talk like a President, and pi is a Perfect base.
idk why people`s say Hyperion is the Perfect base blablabla[/quote]
then Don’t talk Like This

its design isn’t perfect but it is far better than PI. the only pro i can see about using PI, (though it’s irrelevant since he just specified for it to have at least packet handling) is the abundance of content

Read full topic
